page.title: 03St Michael and All Angels
page.content: Church of England at Martin Hussingtree. Thought to have been built by the Pyrie family in the 12th C. Restored in the 17th C, added to in the 19th C. Built of sandstone, it has a small wooden steeple and half-timbered entrance porch. There are two bells which summon the 40 strong congregation to services. Rev. Willis has the united benefice of Martin Hussingtree, Salwarpe and Hindlip. Inside are memorial plaques on white painted walls. The ceiling is panelled wood and from it hangs a cast iron chandelier. Stained glass in memory of hunting field master (dec'd 1898). Peter Walker, MP, Secretary of State for Energy and MP for Worcester used to live nearby and worshipped at the Church.
